text: Great staff here and good for family holidays. There is a kids pool a main pool with a bar inside, and a quiet pool no floats allowed in there. There a 5 amazing slides, very good for kids the all inclusive food is quite good if you like to try different stuff breakfast has full English, very tasty. No need to learn Portuguese as the staff know English, Overall a great experience 5 stars. Would recommend.üòÉ

We booked our stay at Jupiter directly with them, from our initial contact they were great.Upon arrival they gave us access to a dressing room to change, as our room wasn‚Äôt quiet ready - we did arrive around 11am but we did feel welcome.The hotel was fantastic for both couples and families. The rooms are beautifully decorated and comfortable. We paid extra for the mini bar (‚Ç¨25) which a one off fee but was topped up every day with the things we had used.The main pool/slides area is perfect for families and provides plenty of activities for children of all ages (inc adults). The entertainment staff are very helpful and will keep the children entertained.We spent most of our time at the quieter pool and this was very nice.The restaurants and bars were great and the staff were very helpful/friendly.We would definitely return to this resort and would also recommend to anyone who wants a hotel in this area.

I cannot recommend this hotel enough. We have just returned from a truly amazing holiday. From the second we arrived the staff were amazing, the hotel is immaculate, food amazing, rooms big with lovely touches such as tent in the family rooms. Our children were ill on the first night (nothing to do with the hotel) and housekeeping couldn't do enough to help. We were given spare bedding and water without asking. The pools and flumes were more than enough to keep us entertained for a week. Tip for anyone travelling with dietary requirements - if you want dairy free ice cream or cheese/pizza go to the Pizzeria and ask for it. It took us a while to find out where to get it from. The food for the main buffet doesn't have food labels for each dish but if you ask at the restaurant reception they are more than willing to help.We had an amazing holiday and will be returning!

A hidden location, beautiful gardens and common spaces. Excellent dinner. Staff is young, friendly and efficient. The bar is a great meeting point. Nearby, the fantastic coast of Alentejo, with towering cliffs and dense flora and fauna.

Great hotel for a family, kids had a ball there is plenty to do during the day for kids, the entertainment team are excellent!Didn‚Äôt feel like we had much in the vicinity of the hotel for walking too so would have to have trips booked unless you where happy spending your trip within the hotel!Staff are very attentive and food is good!

This was my first time in Madeira. I would stay in an AirBnB the next time I come.Positives:-Close to the marina, shops and the promenade.-Comfortable room and a walkable hotel-close to shops and a grocery store (bottom floor of La Vie)-Quiet-Cute patio and great views. Their bottle of rose is cheap at their bar.Negatives:-You have to pay to use the in room safe-The breakfast and coffee is nothing to be desired. I went to get coffee afterwards. They also have a sign that says you can't take food out of the breakfast room or else you'll be charged.-The concierge didn't know about the bus system and couldn't answer touristy questions.

We had a very pleasant stay at this hotel the staff were helpful with a good explanation of the hotel facility's and how to access them. our room was a junior suite located on the front corner of the hotel. this had an amazing view from the bed as well as the balcony, the room it self was a great size with a huge bath that was sited so you could look out over the sea whilst relaxing in it.The breakfast and evening meal buffet was plentiful.
Amazing in every way!Every member of staff was polite, courteous and super helpful.We will definitely be returning.

Can't fault this hotel for its location and staff both excellent. I would like to give special credit to the reception staff who were very kind, genuine people, and went the extra mile. There was a mix up with the room (a genuine mistake) which was quickly rectified and the lady on the reception couldn't have been more apologetic. The room was nice and spacious and air con worked well. Breakfast was fairly basic but understandable as they have limited space so a bigger spread wouldn't be practical. Overall a very good stay, in the heart of Funchal. Location couldn't be better. Finally a massive thank you to all the staff, you do a great job.

hotel_name: Quinta Nova Winery House - Relais & Ch√¢teaux
text: I stayed two nights in the Quinta in April and also had dinner there two consecutive nights.The Quinta is one located on top of a hill, roughly 25 minutes drive away from Pinhao. Given its location, you actually have no real choice for dinner but to have it at the Quinta (unless you feel like driving at night on narrow mountain winding  roads!) but this is okay because the restaurant is really nice and food is very tasty. Menu is a bit pricy (42 euros) but it is worth it. Wines are obviously Quinta's wines and very affordable. Waitress at the restaurant for dinner was very nice and extremely professional. Breakfast was good, fantastic juice, coffee not great but there is also a coffee machine, waiter was nice but a bit stressed and nervous when too many people arrived at the same time and had to re-fill the buffet but okay. Fresh products at breakfast, variety was okay but not so impressive. Bedroom was nice, bed mattresses and pillows are amazingly comfy, bathroom was good, there is air conditioning in the bedroom too. TV signal was not great but you don't go there to watch tv for hours. Wifi only in the common area, but that's okay.The property is quite big and there are walking trails too to visit vineyard. We had a tour and a tasting session with a guide who was really nice and very professional.One regret that I have however is on the consistency of the service and communication: this stay in the Douro was supposed to be the highlight of our trip across Portugal but when we arrived we were a bit disappointed as they're building a wine museum and there is a crane in the middle of the property and works going on that are quite noisy as you can imagine. I was told these works will be finished for this summer. The pool was also closed as they were refurbishing the pavement, which was also a pity since it was quite hot when we were there and we would have loved to use it, especially since it is a really nice pool overlooking the Douro. No big deal but I really regret not being informed upfront about these works and the inconvenience caused. How difficult was it to send an email to customers informing them about this? It costs nothing to do this. Are they afraid people will cancel? For a \luxury\" establishment and given the price
month: it is really a fault in my opinion. Finally
year: all the staff we met were very friendly and professional in general. Staff at reception could have been more friendly and less cold...I even had to show the email they had sent to me to claim our tour and wine tasting as the man at reception wanted to charge us for this while the offer said it was included ! All quintas now charged tours and wine tasting
extracted_date_str: which I find a pity but charging your hotel guests for this is not the right thing to do in my opinion. We had our tour and tasting session organized as planned eventually...I hope the owners will take in consideration the above remarks if they want to maintain and improve their so-called \"luxury\" status as this is the kind of details that make your stay memorable or not. This is why I give it this average mark. If i had been informed about the works and if I did not have to claim what was included in the offer
extracted_date: I would have probably given a much better mark."

text: We made a last minute booking for a fortnight in the Hotel Madeira and it was definitely a great choice. The hotel is in an excellent, central location - close to lots of good restaurants, the waterfront, lots of attractions like Blandy‚Äôs, the cable car and boat trips. Also 5 mins walk to bus stops taking you anywhere on the island and a taxi rank.The staff are friendly, especially Pedro, Miguel and Sonia. The breakfast is basic but fine, though coffee could be improved. The rooftop terrace is lovely, with a pool and bar. The bar re-opened on our second day there, but only in the afternoons which was a shame as the roof is a lovely place to enjoy an evening drink.The room was well equipped and very clean. Unusually for 3*, the shower was good and WiFi excellent. My only quibble was the balcony which was tiny with barely room for the two chairs and very enclosed by slatted windows, only one of which opened. Perhaps it‚Äôs a health & safety thing, but‚Ä¶. Luckily as we were on the 4th floor, it was only a few steps to the roof terrace.We normally stay in self-catering so it was new to spend so long in a hotel, but we didn‚Äôt regret it and would happily stay here again.

This was my best stay in Madeira, and maybe in all the Portugal. The bulging from 1920's still bears the unique spirit of those days. The domestic ambiance of the hotel is accomplished with pleasant things like indoor pool and sauna. The building surrounded with kinda small botanic garden. But, wherever you go or drive from it- you encounter picturesque landscapes of this still, remote place.Come here if you're after cooling down your brains, tight sleeping, and the fresh air, and don't move anywhere far for a couple of days. We enjoyed it to the fullest extent!Thank you PortoBay for hosting us!We'll be back sooner or later

Leonard was the most exceptional worker and always had a smile and went out of his way and made our holiday more present the apartment  was huge we had everything  we need it hotel staff was always helpful food always different  but wasn't  the best but after all we were comfortable and all the facilities are nice and clean .From Aaron and Wayne

This hotel has a beautiful setting built into the cliffs of Ponto do Sol, with great views from all areas, the rooms, the pool and the restaurant. It has clearly been thoughtfully designed to fit into its surroundings and the simplicity of this design creates a lovely relaxed atmosphere. The breakfast is ok, the dinner was very good (though more expensive than other restaurants in the town - to be expected given the superior food & great views on offer). The hotel provide free return shuttles to the Levada walks each day which we found to be a huge bonus. Highly recommend this hotel.

date: Maurice A Pwrote a review Jun 2018
text: This is one of the worst hotels my wife and I have ever experienced and was so bad that we refused to eat breakfast after the first morning and abandoned the last night of our three night stay. When we arrived, we got no more than a glance from a very unpleasant and condescending receptionist who neither welcomed nor greeted us. Our room was little better than a jail cell, not least because of its cramped dimensions and its looking out onto an internal light well across from other guests passing corridor windows. To reach the room, we had to negotiate flights of stairs after leaving the lift. It took over an hour's persistence before we were moved to another room, which was better but nothing like the images on the hotel's web site. Breakfast the next morning was appalling. The canteen staff were rude and astonishing unhelpful and the choice of food was woeful. There was no proper coffee, which is inexcusable these days. A daily fee is levied to use the safe box in a room. The hotel bears little resemblance to its presentation on its web site, which is misleading in the extreme, and we would advise anyone asking us to avoid it. The cost of a room in this hotel are excessive compared to its lack of quality. There are far better hotels in Funchal that are pleasant to stay in and far better value than this one. Our access to the formal complaints book that all hotels must have on Madeira and that are regularly inspected by the authorities was denied.

I've never stayed at a hostel before Lisbon Destination Hostel - and now I think I'm spoiled! What a great experience. Super clean, staff were friendly, and the BEDS HAVE CURTAINS. That's really important for me when sleeping in a shared space (the idea of people potentially watching me sleep creeps me out). Overall, I'd highly recommend this place and would definitely return if I ever go back to Lisbon. For reference: I stayed in a 4 bed mixed dorm.

hotel_name: Pine Cliffs Ocean Suites, A Luxury Collection Resort & Spa
text: Not a 5* hotel and not really luxury as they claim. Part of a large holiday house complex. Nice lobby area but once you get closer to to your room it becomes a sad story with the charm of a hospital. We booked a ocean one bedroom suit. Good 4* level but not more.

Just returned after spending a wonderful week at this traditional,perfectly placed hotel in the centre of Funchal.It‚Äôs always a good sign when the Portuguese people choose to stay here as you know you have chosen well.The room we had was small,though a little dark it was adequate with a great power shower.All staff from check in to leaving were exceptionally friendly and helpful.Breakfast was ample and all nationalities were catered for.The rooftop bar was amazing with fantastic views both day and night over the surrounding area.Ideally located with a great traditional feel this hotel suited us down to the ground and it was the right decision to stay here.Thanks to everyone @ Hotel Madeira.

Large, clean, comfortable self-catering apartment. Fully equipped with everything you will require. Very friendly helpful staff rooms cleaned daily. 10 mins walk to the amazing beach. Free Shuttle bus between nearby towns. Grocery shopping nearby and open till late.Easy check in and out, they phone your airport transfer for you and store your luggage securely whilst you wait. Hotel food bland cater for the masses. Plenty good restaurants to choose from. We will do this fantastic trip again.

hotel_name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira
text: We had the best stay. Service was amazing and friendly. We definitely want to come again. The property itself is incredibly beautiful and tastefully furnished.

Very disappointing stay. From check-in there was no welcome, only rude demands. Staff show no interest in guests ‚Äî they just do the bare minimum, with no sense of hospitality. If you‚Äôre unlucky enough to stay in an end-of-corridor apartment, you‚Äôll have to deal with maids resting all afternoon, speaking loudly, and laughing as if they were in a bar. Pool towels are a particular embarrassment: if you need a fresh one, you practically have to beg for it.The restaurant was also frustrating: although we were told it wasn‚Äôt necessary to book with half board, we were treated poorly when we didn‚Äôt reserve, even though we had already paid. They claimed there might not be enough food for us.Our advice: give proper professional training to your staff, or close the doors! The location is great, but that alone doesn‚Äôt make up for everything else.

Modern, Clean and helpful staff but not close to the touristy parts of Lisbon but in a decent neighborhood.  Very good hotel for a meeting but would be a bit hard to tour from here.  Solid Marriott experience.

A lovely return to our time share villa in mainly good weather. As usual the staff are friendly and helpful, La Quinta put on lots of activities to appeal to children and we were given free tickets for the golf at the last day of the Portugal Masters. The resort is relaxing, the beach unending and it's fun to take mountain bikes to explore the salt marches are see so many types of migratory wading birds. And then take lunch at Waxis in Faro Village. Plenty to do at FSF as well with the gym, heated and outdoor pools and comfortable bar and nice club restaurant. Highly recommended

Stayed in the hotel from 31st of May to 3rd of June 2017. We made a reservation through our travel agent and ask for a suite with quite location in the hotel. When we arrived, we saw the constraction in front of the hotel, very noisy. When we got our suite we notised that all our windows facing the constraction and its very noisy in the room. We asked to change it to different suite but we was told that all the suites are on the same (2nd) floor and facing the constraction. I called our travel agent to complain and I was told that they are surprised also and nobody notify them about the constraction. We had to put up with noise all three days we stayed in the hotel. It was very annoying when you come to the room during the day to relax for a few hours and had to listen to all the constraction noises.Except that the hotel is nice and the personnel is friendly and proffesional.

At the moment there is a very loud construction project happening right beside the hotel which starts work at 8am.The hotel in general is very nice. Comfortable beds and a powerful shower. The breakfast is fine, although the quality of the coffee and pastries could be higher given the star rating of the hotel. The staff are all very very helpful and friendly.We had room service and the food was also fairly low quality.I had family staying in another nearby hotel that cost less and had lovely amenities, so that may be worth considering. As another reviewer noted - you only get one set of coffee pods for the machine and you have to pay quite a bit extra for more (2.50).

hotel_name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira
text: Magnificent on every level! Great for every type of traveler. We spent the first day of our vacation enjoying the beautiful grounds, ocean, pool, tennis court, spa, food. Every single thing was perfection

Another great visit which on the whole was very quiet and laid back.The only negative feedback would be the excessive noise levels at the poolside for the aqua gym sessions and the badly organised bus trips after 5.30 to and from Tavira.

We visited Four Season Fairways this January, for a family break. Service was great. Friendly, helpful staff. Great pool - kids loved it! Superb shinning apartments with views over the golf course. An they had a special offer that helped me introduce golf to my son. Loved it!

hotel_name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira
text: We travelled as a family of four and stayed one week in Madeira at the Belmond. The hotel is everything you would expect from a Belmond one, and beyond. Special highlights included the varied restaurant options, (the breakfasts alone are 7 star!), the direct access to the atlantic, the gorgeous pool and gardens and the ease with which to do activities in and around the island. The staff are faultless and their good nature, helpfulness and friendliness is consistent. If you are looking for a proper break from \real life\" Madeira and at the Belomond is a sure thing!"

Amazing overall experience of this beautiful hotel, situated on the tip of Gaia with stunning panoramic views over the Rio Duoro. Walking in to the hustle and bustle of the touristy areas of Porto is approx 20 min walk (or approx ‚Ç¨5 in a taxi).The hotel has a stunning spa, which my wife didn't hesitate to book treatments in (!!) and both outdoor and indoor swimming pools (the indoor needs to be booked to guarantee a slot which we liked as they only ever allowed 8 people to use maximum, and we often had the whole pool, steam room and sauna all to ourselves). The hotel breakfast I would give a 3 out of 5. I've had better and the service was super slow when waiting on drinks and menu ordered eggs. We only had the breakfast once but it's easy just to go out of breakfast or brunch.Immediately to the back of the hotel within a couple of minutes walk are markets, bars, and a lovely port cave tour. Access to the cable cars and the Jardim do Morro for stunning sunset views are within easy walking distance.In summary, as a family we do appreciate the finer things in life and I'd say this hotel is up there and would stay here again very happily when visiting beautiful Porto again!

We very much enjoyed staying at the hotel. Very comfortable beds. Quiet to sleep at night. Room very clean. Excellent breakfast buffet. Relaxed breakfast on the terrace. Nice bartenders. Good location.

Back again for a week's visit at the end of April for the first time in 18 months, and pleased to see that standards are being maintained in all departments.We noted that the hotel corridors and public areas had been re-carpeted (excellent quality job), and that restaurant and poolside area menus were updated since our last visit too. Food and drink prices seemed more than reasonable when taking advantage of any of the available packages on offer.The pool and garden areas are in good order - lots of bedding plants in evidence in the flowered areas, but, as on our last few visits, we noted streaking and discolouration below many of the balconies, which is a pity and not in keeping with the rest of the hotel.Other than that, it's fair to say the Royal Savoy is deserving of it's 5 stars - the staff are all lovely, the ambience charming, and we will return soon no doubt.

hotel_name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira
text: Excellent stay at Reid‚Äôs. We‚Äôve been to Madeira twice before but wouldn‚Äôt look to stay anywhere else in future. The staff are trained to perfection but really want your stay to go well. They all seem so happy to ensure the service they provide is top drawer. Try both restaurants (William and Cipriani) if you can. Expensive but great value for the money.
Loved it especially the staff the entertainment team was very nice and bright for my little brother definitely going again because of them

date: Steve n Annwrote a review Jul 2017
text: What an amazing stay at a 1st class hotel! I can't say enough about the Tivoli, it was like staying in a brand new hotel, you just couldn't fault it and all the staff were very helpful, but that's the Portuguese for you. A fantastic place to stay! üëç

Park is big and lovely but the people responsible for the gate are awful.Tried to ask for some help and when I said ‚Äúhi‚Äù this guy said hi back but did t turn his back, so I said can I ask you a question and he‚Äôs behavior was absolutely awful and useless, not being willing to listen or help AT ALL.

the location of this hotel is just perfect next to the beach and few minutes walk to the marina and shops, stayed in room 232 must be the best in the hotel, loved the shower screen,  the view from the huge terrace (bigger than our garden) were absolutely stunning, we hardly moved from there for the 2 days we stayed, if we could guarantee this room next year for 2 weeks I would book tomorrow!!! the staff were polite and friendly, the breakfast was lovely, room service too, too much to choose from, we were at a hotel next door for the first week of our holiday and decided to extend by 2 days unfortunately they were fully booked, im so glad we decided to stay here and hopefully be back next year

Lovely stay we stayed for 5 nights room 127 huge room separate kitchen,front room 2 beds table/chairs tv, bedroom so spacious washing machine a bonus only downside you don't get sun on the balcony from 11/12 staff very friendly.great facilities and perfect location,food is good we found drinks a tad expensive to other hotels we have stayed in but would still return
A special hotel on the island of Madeira. From the accommodations, to the sympathy of the staff, to the viewpoint with a unique view. Experience 5 stars at all levels!

Myself and a friend are currently on holiday at this hotel, we are staying all inclusive. We had heard mixed reviews so were not expecting much however we were pleasantly surprised. The buffet has a small but something for everyone. We have managed to get a reservation at Indian Thali which we thoroughly enjoyed- chef is very attentive and checked we were happy with our meals which were authentic and tasty.

I will firstly start with the positives, the hotel is extremely clean and tidy, the shower is very nice and relaxing, the towels in the room lovely and soft and we were able to check into our room as soon as we arrived with no ques at reception. The room cleaners were very good too.I will now list the negatives:There were no staff on the door greeting guests when arrived in their cars at certain times.The breakfast was  very dissapointing, the poached eggs were under cooked, no english tea.The outdoor pool is very cold.Not enough sunbeds  around the pool, had to go to the beach on two of the days as couldn‚Äôt get a sunbed. Expected the hotel to have sunbeds on part of the beach that we could use with the beach being so close but unfortunately not.  There were no private beds to hire either on the beach as they were all reserved, so had to lay on a towel on the sand (not what you expect when paying 5 star prices. The towel attendants very unhelpful. Getting a drink around the pool was near impossible unless you went to the bar yourself. Long wait to get any drinks or food in pool bar and outdoor bar area. All staff in hotel seemed miserable and unhelpful.Decided to visit the indoor spa area, jacuzzi closed and the indoor pool was freezing we left after 10mins. We asked if we could change our english money to euros in the hotel, was told no and no help trying to locate somewhere to change our money.In other hotels nothing is too much trouble, in this hotel you get the impression that everything is too much trouble. If we visit vilamoura again we will try the Tivoli.

We stayed here for 9 nights in a suite. Staff is very welcoming and friendly. The suite was great, with a living room, a kitchen and a big bathroom. Hotel style is a modern: wood and concrete. During low season this gives the hotel a bit of a desolated feeling. On the other hand, it doesn‚Äôt overwhelm you and gives you a sense of being at peace in the middle of nowhere, which you are. Since you‚Äôre roughly in the middle of the island you can reach everything in 75 minutes maximum. Great location. We loved the ocean view as well. One of two five star hotels on the island. Highly recommended!

Booked for myself my mother and daughter...difficult to cater for ages between 24 and 72..but this hotel has it all..eco friendly and so close to the action but far enough away so you can have a peaceful time..apartment was idea and well equipped even had a washing machine, a first for me in a self catering apartment in Europe..even supplied washing tablets...the hotel and grounds were well kept and the staff were very helpful..we will return and we had a fantastic stay

I stayed here for 1 nights. I added one extra night in lisbon and I arrived late at night so I think to spend something cheaper just for a night.The room was small but with I payed for I think it was ok for europe. I got three windows there, so its quite a big room. However the shower is pack. But again its ok.Its a boutique budget hotel. They give you breakfast and I find it nice touch. I like orange and the sponge cake.Its not much to talk about, but It was ok. Near the train station and stores. And the staffs are nice and helpful. Very warm too. So I got nothing to complain about.What they can do better is to take out all the uneccesary nick nacks in the room and add a lil more water pressure in the shower.

The choreographer and dj Lauro and the dancers Yoandry,Nirma,cinder and Leyanna wosBrilliant show great talent and interaction √∞≈∏Àú≈† definitely would recommend staff so friendly and dancers where brilliant. Family holiday made really interactive and fun.
Excellent!!! A beautiful, quiet and ideal space for families. Excellence reception from the first to the last day of our stay.

We have stayed at the Vila Gale for the past five years for a week in March/ April and have never been disappointed. The staff from reception to cleaners are extremely helpful and friendly and ensure that your stay is a pleasurable one. I concede that some parts of the hotel's decor is beginning to look a little tired, but the cleanliness is beyond reproach. We always stay bed and breakfast and have found the selection and quality of the food to be superb. the only negative I would post is that the beds are a little on the hard side, but I understand that they have been refurbished lat year. We will be arriving on 11 th April for a week and as usual are really looking forward to our stay I the beautiful town of Tavira.

This is a pleasant hotel ideally situated with only a 5 minute walk to the strip, a 10 minute walk to the beach or 15 minute walk to the old town. Our room was spacious and well equipped for a self catering holiday, room was cleaned daily with towels changed. The type of guests that stayed here were mostly couples and European. The only down side of our stay was the hotel that is directly opposite and shared the pool, the guests that seem to occupy that hotel are mostly stag/hen party's and obviously can be quite loud especially between Thursday and Monday when they all seem to arrive, it's such a shame because it can put you off returning to our hotel.

Canto de Luz was by far the best accommodation we stayed in during our trip to Portugal. Great location and delicious breakfast. We had a lovely room on the third floor with a garden view. There is an elevator which was handy for moving our luggage. The staff are friendly, proactive and helpful. Communication ahead of our arrival was very professional, including recommendations on restaurants and tours. I would not hesitate to stay there again and would happily recommend it to anyone visiting Porto.

Canto de Luz is an amazing gem in the center of Porto. Everything from check-in, to local suggestions and help with (restaurant) reservations were done perfectly. Their staff communication through whatsapp is thoughtful and sincere, we really could not have asked for a better place to spend our few days in Porto before leaving for our roadtrip through the Douro valley.

hotel_name: Porto Pal√É¬°cio Hotel by The Editory
text: This is one of the classic luxury hotels in Porto and it lives up to its reputation. Excellent service and staff, great location and quality. The rooms are very good and luxurious. Value is also excellent!

Room with a balcony and two floors up didn't quite deafen the noise from the road at night but it was not outwith peak time so it was fine. Customer service was excellent. Recommend buffet breakfast, Reception ordered taxis which picked up from the main entrance. Recommend hotel book airport taxi at fixed price of 30 euros. Overall a good stay and would stay again.I would like a couple of chairs on the balcony would be a handy addition.

Well run popular site. Pitches a bit exposed but the positives outweigh any negatives. Clean facilities. Laundry particularly impressive with large exterior lines for drying large items away from pitches. Wifi a bit erratic but free.

date: jose carlos Moreirawrote a review Jul 2024
text: I went to dinner with my wife, it started badly, right at the check-in, the number that appears on the NET is from the accommodation the girl who answered the phone became very angry because the number is wrong and after 3 minutes of messy conversation there gave the restaurant number. Ok Reservation done!!! From the entrance a board with 3 regional and good quality cheese triangles and a splash of painful quality, I ordered a premium steak to my wife chocos, the follow-up was strictly the same for both dishes .... The steak  √¢¬Å‚Ä°  was very hard and tasteless the choco was not bad but the accompaniment of roasted potatoes and mango of chestnut and cabbage did not link with choco and tb bad with the steak. The room is banal the service is weak lack more 2 employees to help the lonely and friendly maid.The view and the frame are fantastic

Quinta das Achadas is in a super spot, on its own, peaceful and beautiful, 2 mins by car from Odiaxere - pronounce: O-dee-ash-ay - which is a kind of dormitory suburb of Lagos - pronounce: la-goosh - which is only a further 5 mins or so. Faro Airport is less than an hour. It's at the Western end of the Algarve, where the landscape is still green and unspoiled, the beaches golden and likewise unspoiled, the walks on cliffs and hills are fabulous, the towns and sights (castles, museums, churches) fascinating, and watch out for the storks and flamingoes. Julio and Jill gave us the warmest - literally! - of welcomes - as they will anyone lucky enough to stay in their little corner of Portuguese paradise.

spent 4 nights here front of house staff pleasant and efficient booking in was easy we had car so we were given a parking  voucher before we booked in which was good. the room was ok but badly laid out not enough room in front of the bed to work on the desk which was full occupied by th tv which should have been mounted on the wall. But the bed was very good we slept well.the Buffet breakfast was also great value. the metro was just outside the main entrance
My compliments to Jean-Paul and his team. This hotel has everything you need: Comfortable rooms with a personal touch and nice design, excellent location and a very relaxed atmosphere.

We had a lovely 5 nights at this beautiful hotel.  Our suite was perfect for the 3 of us and had a lovely big balcony overlooking the fabulous tropical gardens.  The pools are gorgeous and the breakfast and staff similarly wonderful.  We would return in a heartbeat.

date: Olga Fabiola Mwrote a review Sep 2024
text: We went in January 2024. Very comfortable hotel. It may not be that close to the center, but walking is not complex and , besides, it is very safe. The stay was very good and the staff is very friendly and welcoming. We would definitely return to Lisbon.

Mare is just about the place to stay at Nazare, their rooms are done up just as per the feel of the city. Calm n relaxed with that aqua touch all over.But their breakfast needs to be upgraded with more options. It was too basic.Overall the staff of extra friendly especially at the reception, they're always smiling and ready to guide you.

The cab driver had a hard time locating the hotel (I think he was new!) which is in a residential district close to Marques de Pombal Square.   The receprionist was very efficient and apologised for giving us a room other than the one we booked (for 1 night we just booked a standard double).   Not a problem as we were given the penthouse suite - 3 double bedrooms each with en-suite, powder room, hughe living/dining room, fully equipped eat-in kitchen and an enormous patio.  Very nice!   We walked to the center stopping for a snack on the way and returned on the metro - very easy.   On the way back we stopped in the grocery store and bought breakfast and supper items then stayed put enjoying our patio.   The pool was inviting and, since it was 40 degrees Hubby found it very refreshing.   Breakfast was not included in our rate si I cannot comment on it.We thoroughly enjoyed our brief stay and will return when we are next in Lisbon.   The quiet, comfort and pool make up for being a little out of town.  Of course we will probobly get a regular room next time although the penthouse would make sense if travelling with friends or family as each bedroom/bathroom was self contained.

We got a great rate at this hotel from American Express travel that includes breakfast.  Hotel is close to metro station.  It is convenient to go to the airport with only one line, no need to change train.  However you have to climb a lot of stairs to get out from the metro exit so you need to prepare if you have heavy luggages.  There is a big department store near the hotel.  There is also a clean and safe self service laundry service about 10 minutes walk from the hotel.  Breakfast at the hotel is excellent.  The staff at the breakfast room is also kind enough to let us eat breakfast early because we have an early flight to catch.  Room is clean and quiet.

Really good hotel, with good spacious rooms.Excellent breakfast and cozy outdoor environment with lounge chairs and pool.The hotel is within walking distance of the center and there are many good restaurants nearby.

Great stay at this hotel. Stayed 3 nights with family and had an amazing experience. Great location and staff was great. Great location. Indoor pool/jacuzzi was amazing. Kids are only allowed till 12pm

Just got back from a girls holiday, few positives of the hotel for us, the pool area was livley so good if that√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s what your after and the Italian was lovely. However getting sun lounger if your not up early is basically impossible as all were reserved by 9:30am and no where near enough for the amount of people in the hotel.Our aircon wasn√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢t working from the moment we got to our room, I asked reception to send maintenance and they did however it still didn√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢t get fixed. This repeated 4 times and each time it did not get fixed. It was extremely hard to sleep in the heat and we could not open the windows due to the noise. On the last night we could not get ready due to the heat I went to reception who said yes we know the gas is broke so it can√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢t be fixed. No one had told us this, I asked to move rooms and they said the hotel was full. They said they could send an air conditioning unit I said we need two as there were two bedrooms they only send one so we had to go to reception again. It was very tedious. The flush in both rooms was also broke and the rooms cleaned once during our 5 day stay and not really cleaned at all, we ran out of toilet roll and floors not cleaned. When we got to the room there was also things left from the people before us (dirty boxers being one).Okay if your just looking for a party holiday however we wanted to chill too, I also would have booked a different hotel if I knew we would have no air con for the whole time

This hostel has a lot going for itself: Clean rooms, friendly staff, a very central, convenient location. It is not terribly noisy despite being on a major street. The kitchen seemed well equipped (I didn't use it other than at breakfast).Loved the privacy curtain on my (lower bunk) bed.

We were very well received. Very good breakfast in a very pleasant space, with a wide variety of good quality food, always accompanied by the smiles of the employees.Excellent room, very clean and very comfortable.Very beautiful and well maintained guesthouse. Great rooms and fantastic employees.

date: Janet Anne Wwrote a review Oct 2019
text: Beautiful Parkland setting, a short walk to the world heritage site.The staff all spoke excellent English particularly in the bar. Fransisco and Pedro made us feel very welcome.My friend was visiting Tomar for his first time and was very impressed by the hotel and town. It was the 4th or 5th visit for my husband and myself, we always love it.

We booked a room in January for 8 nights paying in full unfortunaely we chose the  non refundable rate. Having never not gone when booked. When our flight to Porto was cancelled by Easyjet due to the Corvid-19 crisis we attempted to move this reservation to 2021. After a refusal via booking.com we attempted to contact the hotel direct. After Phoning the reception we obtained the E-mail address of the manager. Who after several attempts did not respond. I again phoned the hotel but the receptionist very politely informed us only the manager could do anything for us.  After a payment of 389 pounds the least he could do was to reply to us.  We do not recommend this hotel and will not use it when we visit Porto again

On the way to our holiday, a two night stay, but excellent.We thank Mrs Filipa David and the staff who were lovely and very professional.Ideal for staying away from noise and 10 minutes drive from Cascais.Very varied and hearty breakfast.Superior double room with balcony recommended. Exceptional golf view (facing south).
